comment: Don't let the optional final fool you, you will probably end up taking it. Lectures are all over the place, very disorganized. Quizzes are 10x harder than any of the tests and homework, almost impossible to do good on. Does allow a notecard on test. Also does not use textbook, uses his own slides with many typos.

He is disorganized, unprepared, & doesn't summarize material effectively. His lectures rely heavily on textbook PPTs, & he lacks confidence in answering questions. Many students dropped the class (from 60 to 48), which is concerning. If you're not proficient in math or want a clear understanding of finance, it's best to take another instructor.

Fin 3100 can be challenging, but Prof. Spivey provides plenty of opportunities to secure a good grade. The course consists of roughly 10 quizzes and homework assignments along with three exams and an optional final that replaces all grades lower than it. Definitely become familiar with excel because it makes the math very manageable.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment: Professor Spivey was adequate, he always opened with real-life situations occurring in finance. The class was difficult for me as the material simply didn't click, but he posted solutions to homework and quizzes, and responded to emails within a day. A notecard is allowed on exams, and the final is optional but will replace lower grades if taken.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment:
Before you even talk about the class itself, the professor allows the final to replace EVERY grade thats lower then the final, so that in itself is huge

He also is a good professor (Lecture wise) and posts all quizzes and exams on D2L which allows you to study easily.

Dr. Spivey is a good professor. Fin 3100 is not an easy course and you will have to do a LOT of studying and KSU tutoring if you aren't proficient at math. Others in my class said he's great with 1 on 1 help so do take advantage of that. My only gripe is that he sucks at D2L, you'll have to remind him to post hw answers or to post a lecture.

Honestly Spivey is a nice guy but does not know the material he's teaching. He's usually clueless in class to what he's supposed to be teaching us and gives homework that is 100 times harder than anything he covers in his lectures. Also says he posts answers to said homework but the "answers" do not help at all. do not take him.

Not gonna lie I got into his class last minute but I didn't think this class would be that bad. Great lectures but terrible quizzes/exams. He curves grades but mostly because everyone did so bad. Spivey needs to remember that we are college students and not financial experts, because this does not feel like a principles class. Would not recommend
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment:
Good professor he is. 10 pop quizzes he gave, so come to class you must. Teaches well through lecture, and can be funny. No electronics, only paper notes, so if you don't mind, this class you should take.
- Yoda

comment: 4 tests non-cumulative but hinted the final would be cumulative in the future, 10 open note pop quizzes and no homework (hinted this would change too). Everything paper/pencil, notecards, & no screens allowed in class. That being said, his lectures are the best so you HAVE to show up and listen. He makes it enjoyable and he wants you to succeed.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Beware of pop quizzes--Graded by few things

comment: He is so funny. He is the best professor I have ever had! If you show up he will make sure you understand the material. Pop quizzes are easy as long as you show up, and are very beneficial for exams. I would 1000% recommend professor Spivey.
This guy is the best. He listens to his students and tries to make the class better for us. Easy class is you do the work.

Professor Spivey is one of the best profs I have ever had! He is passionate about teaching and knows his Finance. I always felt comfortable asking him questions and if you show up and participate you will do well in his class.

Professor Spivey is an amazing professor. He really cares about his students and how they succeed in class. There are pop quizzes, but they are really to help you do better on exams. They are straightforward as long as you are keeping up with what is going on in class. You get a notecard for help on the tests which are in person. No homework.

Professor Spivey isn't a terrible professor, he cares and wants you to learn but he is very OLD fashioned. He has a strict no electronic policy, every note you take will be hand written. There is no homework, so all your grades are based off test and POP quizzes. He makes class attendance mandatory by not letting you know when the quiz will be.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things
